item.title: Media Coverage

item.description: We’ve had a bit of press since we built this quadcopter! Here are a few of the sites we’ve been featured on. Ars Technica DIY Drones Thingiverse
item.content:encoded:
We’ve had a bit of press since we built this quadcopter! Here are a few of the sites we’ve been featured on.

Ars Technica
DIY Drones
Thingiverse

item.title: Welcome Students & Enthusiasts!
item.dc:creator: Garrett
item.description: This is a project website for a group who took a Mechatronics course (SEng 466) at the University of Victoria in Victoria, BC. We designed, built, and programmed a quadcopter using Solidworks, a MakerBot 3D printer, and a modified version … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
This is a project website for a group who took a Mechatronics course (SEng 466) at the University of Victoria in Victoria, BC. We designed, built, and programmed a quadcopter using Solidworks, a MakerBot 3D printer, and a modified version of the AeroQuad software.

If you have any comments or questions, feel free to leave a comment on this post or anywhere else on this site.

Project 1 details a preliminary project not having to do with the quadcopter.

Project 2 explains most details about the mechanical design of the quadcopter frame.

Project 3 shows some modifications we made to the AeroQuad software and some demonstration videos of the copter flying.

Thanks for visiting!

item.title: Welcome to our SEng466 project site
item.dc:creator: Garrett
item.description: You have reached the project website of Anderson Li, Chris Rennie, and Garrett Owen for SEng466 (Mechatronics) at the University of Victoria. This site will detail 3 projects over the term.  The first being a ball floating apparatus built using two Arduino boards, and the … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded: You have reached the project website of Anderson Li, Chris Rennie, and Garrett Owen for SEng466 (Mechatronics) at the University of Victoria. This site will detail 3 projects over the term.  The first being a ball floating apparatus built using two Arduino boards, and the final two having to do with the design and construction of an autonomous quad copter.  Whoever you are, a future student, instructor, or mechatronics enthusiast, we hope you find this site informational and useful.
